title: Pairing Together Terms
text: We can pair together the first and second terms and the third and fourth terms so that we can later factor. This can be done as shown. $$f(x)=x^3+2x^2+\left(-9x-18\right)$$
speech: We can pair together the first and second terms and the third and fourth terms so that we can later factor. This can be done as shown.  f of x is equal to x cubed plus 2 x squared, plus, parentheses, negative 9 x, minus 18
pacedSpeech: We can pair together the first and second terms and the third and fourth terms so that we can later factor. This can be done as shown.   f of x is equal to x cubed plus 2 x squared, plus, , negative 9 x, minus 18

title: Taking Out the Common Term
text: We must now take out the common term(s) in each pair. $$f(x)=x^{2\left(x+2\right)}-9\left(x+2\right)$$
speech: We must now take out the common term(s) in each pair.  f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times, parentheses x plus 2,  power minus, 9 times, parentheses x plus 2,
pacedSpeech: We must now take out the common term(s) in each pair.   f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times,  x plus 2,  power minus, 9 times,  x plus 2,

title: Joining Together Both Terms
text: Now we must join together both terms by using the common term that was pulled out. $$f(x)=\left(x^2-9\right) \left(x+2\right)$$
speech: Now we must join together both terms by using the common term that was pulled out.  f of x is equal to parentheses, x squared minus 9,  times, parentheses x plus 2,
pacedSpeech: Now we must join together both terms by using the common term that was pulled out.   f of x is equal to , x squared minus 9,  times,  x plus 2,

title: Factoring the Quadratic
text: Finally, we can factor each expression in the parantheses. $$x^2-9=\left(x+3\right) \left(x-3\right)$$. This means that $$f(x)=\left(x+3\right) \left(x-2\right) \left(x+2\right)$$.
speech: Finally, we can factor each expression in the parantheses.  x squared minus 9, is equal to parentheses x plus 3,  times, parentheses x minus 3,  . This means that  f of x is equal to parentheses x plus 3,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  times, parentheses x plus 2,  .
pacedSpeech: Finally, we can factor each expression in the parantheses.   x squared minus 9, is equal to  x plus 3,  times,  x minus 3,
. This means that   f of x is equal to  x plus 3,  times,  x minus 2,  times,  x plus 2,

title: Solving for the Intercepts
text: We can set the factored equation from the previous step equal to $$0$$ in order to solve for $$x$$. $$0=\left(x+3\right) \left(x-2\right) \left(x+2\right)$$. This means that $$x=-3$$, $$2$$, and $$-2$$. This, then, means that our x-intercepts are $$(-3,0),(2,0),(-2,0)$$
speech: We can set the factored equation from the previous step equal to  0  in order to solve for  x .  0 is equal to parentheses x plus 3,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  times, parentheses x plus 2,  . This means that  x is equal to negative 3 ,  2 , and  negative 2 .
